He kisses her hard on the mouth, let's her go She pulls away from him, along the seat.  She doesn't kno what to think of him.  She is terrified, resigned, and at the same time, he still has an attraction for her.
The kiss of death. (laughs) With a new twist.
He lifts the gun in his hand, looks at it, tosses it  overboard.  He reaches inside his coat, takes out the  suicide note.
(reading) "Dear Inspector Killaine.  This is  goodbye.  You were right.  I had a  secret."
The DIESEL ENGINE SOUND has grown louder.  Brandon looks  up from the note.
A secret, Betty---as who hasn't

He crumples the note and envelope in his hand, drops them over the side of the boat.  Opens the engine full throttl and the power of the cruiser almost tears it out from und them.  Betty is thrown violently against the seat.  He  reaches out and straightens her up.  There is a mad light in his eyes.  His face is no longer hard.

Of the chase, alternating with the Cabin Cruiser and the  Lynx, as the Lynx gradually closes in.  During these shot Cabin Cruiser and the Lynx both come out of the fog bank  into moonlit water, but there is another fog bank half a  mile or so ahead.
The Lynx is moving up fast, and the Coast Guard officer  can be seen on the bridge, with binoculars to his eyes. rating, hanging on tight, is stripping the canvas off a  twin machine gun mount.

(above the roar of  the motors) Stand up!  Let them take a good  look at you.  Be sure they see  you.  That fellow back there has  night glasses.  Then jump---well  out to the side.  Just as far as  you can.

Betty does what he tells her.  She waves.  There is an  answering wave from the bridge of the Lynx.  We can't see who's waving.  Betty sets herself to jump.  She tries to  speak to Brandon, but nothing comes out.  There is a grea deal of NOISE from motors.  Gravely, Brandon lifts his  hand and salutes her.  She jumps.
Towards another fog bank beyond the clear space.
Full speed astern.
Full speed astern.
The cutter heaves on reversed engines, nearly stands on  its tail in the water, drifts past Betty, comes to a stop then moves forward slowly, swinging around to get close t her.
HIGH SHOT of Cabin Cruiser as it reaches the fog and plun into it.  HELICOPTER WITH CAMERA plunges into fog at the  same time.

Stopped on the swell.  Betty in the water, fighting her  way towards it.  A life belt and rope are dropped neatly  beside her.  She grabs it and is drawn towards the side o the lynx.  Coast Guard officer, Killaine, and a rating pu rope ladder over the side.  Killaine starts down the rope ladder.

head_text.subj: DOWN FROM THE DECK OF THE LYNX

text: Past Killaine on the rope ladder to water, as Betty is  pulled to foot of ladder.  Killaine reaches down, gets he hand.  She grasps rope ladder, Killaine helps her up onto it.  Business of getting her on board cutter.

Brandon staring straight ahead of him, gripping the wheel hard, giving the cruiser everything it has, driving as if he had a clear, open course.  HEARS A FOGHORN, somewhere  of the fog.  Cocks his head, tries to gauge the direction Turns the wheel a little.

As Betty comes over the side, Killaine holding her up,  Betty is shivering with cold.  The rating hauls up the  rope ladder and the life belt.  Coast Guard signals the  bridge ad the Lynx starts moving ahead again.
(to Betty) Better get those wet clothes off  in a hurry, Miss.  My cabin's at  your disposal.
Thank you.  Thank you very much.
He salutes, turns away, after giving a quick look at  Killaine.
(to Killaine) He could have killed me a dozen  times.  You'd never have known.
We know everything.
(almost passionately) No, Jeff.  You don't.  He's not a  murderer, I tell you.  He;s not a  murderer.
(same tone) I hope he can prove it.  Come on.   You don't want to get pneumonia.
He takes her arm, starts to push her along.  She is still shivering, but still determined to  defend Brandon.
But I tell you---if you'd only  understand.
(gently) I understand, Betty.  I understand  perfectly.
He puts his arm around her.  Their eyes meet in a long  look.

The cruiser is moving at high speed in the fog.  The FOG  HORN SOUND is louder, but seems to come from all directio Brandon is leaning forward, tensely, trying to see ahead. He turns the wheel first one way, and then another.  Ther is a sudden blast of the FOGHORN, very LOUD. Brandon turns the wheel violently and the cruiser keels  over.  But he is now quick enough.  Suddenly above looms  the enormous bow of the Puget Sound Ferry, as big as an  ocean liner.  It is ablaze with light.  CAMERA PANS UP to show it crashing down into the lens as it were.
Thrown out of the water almost, it is up-ended on its ste The ferry tears on through, filling the screen.

location: A CORNER OF THE PASSENGER DECK ON THE FERRY

text: A couple of PASSENGERS in overcoats leaning against the  rail looking out into the fog.  One of them is lighting a cigarette, cupping his hands around the lighter.
You always have this kind of weather  up here?
Certain times of the year.  Always  a lot of fog.  But they never hit  anything, somehow.
At the end of the bridge an OFFICER is leaning down, star towards the water.  He shakes his head, straightens up,  turns away.
(speaking off) An old packing case, I guess.
Its beam is turned down on the water.  The beam moves a  little, back towards the stern.  CAMERA FOLLOWS THE BEAM  DOWN THROUGH THE FOG.  Empty water only is SEEN.  The  searchlight is switched off.

A broken piece of the cabin cruiser's bow floats by, clos and closer to THE CAMERA, until on it the name VALKYRIE  stands out, then it whirls past.  There is nothing left  but the foggy surface of the Sound.
